pullRequest.body:
Add results about operations on the extended real numbers.

- Instances for `EReal`: `CharZero` and `NoZeroDivisors`.
- Results about the coercion to the reals: `toReal_eq_zero_iff`, `toReal_ne_zero_iff`, `toReal_nonneg`, `toReal_nonpos`, `coe_ennreal_toReal`.
- Results about the addition of EReals: `add_ne_bot_iff`, `bot_lt_add_iff`, `add_ne_top` and similar.
- Reorganize and rename the lemmas `le_neg` and similar to make them more consistent, add the missing ones.
- Results about the subtraction of EReals: `top_sub_of_ne_top`, `sub_self`, `sub_self_le_zero`, `sub_nonneg` and similar, `sub_add_cancel` and similar.
- Results about the multiplication of Ereals:  `top_mul_coe_ennreal`, `coe_ennreal_mul_top`, `mul_pos_iff` and similar, `mul_eq_top` and similar, `coe_mul_add_of_nonneg` and other distributivity lemmas, `nsmul_eq_mul`.
- Move and simplify proof of `mul_pos`.
- Clenaup.


---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> Mathlib.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

### PR summary [a174b1e198](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/17087/commits/a174b1e19808aba4289c7db1509e679f84fc4b0e)

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|

</details>

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ add_ne_bot_iff`
`+ add_ne_top`
`+ add_ne_top_iff_of_ne_bot`
`+ add_ne_top_iff_of_ne_bot_of_ne_top`
`+ add_sub_cancel_left`
`+ coe_ennreal_mul_top`
`+ coe_ennreal_toReal`
`+ instance : CharZero EReal := inferInstanceAs (CharZero (WithBot (WithTop ‚Ñù)))`
`+ instance : NoZeroDivisors EReal`
`+ le_neg`
`+ left_distrib_of_nonneg_of_ne_top`
`+ lt_neg`
`+ lt_neg_of_lt_neg`
`+ mul_eq_bot`
`+ mul_eq_top`
`+ mul_ne_bot`
`+ mul_ne_top`
`+ mul_neg_iff`
`+ mul_nonneg_iff`
`+ mul_nonpos_iff`
`+ mul_pos_iff`
`+ neg_lt`
`+ nsmul_eq_mul`
`+ right_distrib_of_nonneg_of_ne_top`
`+ sub_add_cancel`
`+ sub_add_cancel_left`
`+ sub_add_cancel_right`
`+ sub_neg`
`+ sub_nonneg`
`+ sub_nonpos`
`+ sub_pos`
`+ sub_self`
`+ sub_self_le_zero`
`+ toReal_eq_toReal`
`+ toReal_eq_zero_iff`
`+ toReal_ne_zero_iff`
`+ toReal_nonneg`
`+ toReal_nonpos`
`+ top_mul_coe_ennreal`
`+ top_sub_of_ne_top`
`- neg_lt_iff_neg_lt`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

</details>

This is quite a big PR, and contains a lot of changes to reformat existing code in a way that is not backed by a consensus that I'm aware of. I would suggest you start by reverting the formatting changes, and hopefully the rest of the PR will look more approachable.
Thank you @Ruben-VandeVelde, I removed all the formatting changes to existing code, now the PR should look less scary.

pullRequest.title: feat(Data/EReal): Add results about `EReal`
